content: I cannot predict the future with complete accuracy but judging from the current trend, many events have moved online due to the pandemic, and music awards shows have not been an exception. the pandemic has forced many award shows to be held virtually, which is a significant departure from the traditional live performances with a live audience. virtual music award shows have proven to be quite successful, and it is possible that they may become more common, at least for the short term, until life can return to some normalcy. virtual award shows also allow for more accessibility and inclusivity, as fans from all over the world can tune in and participate. however, a live audience is still an essential part of the award show experience, and it is likely that once the pandemic subsides, many award shows will return to in-person events.
